content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata> <idinfo> <citation> <citeinfo> <origin>CEHTP Science Team</origin> <pubdate>20120315</pubdate> <title>Rates of asthma emergency department vists by zip code, California, 2009</title> <onlink/> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript>  <abstract>This dataset contains rates of asthma (ICD9-CM 493.0-493.9) emergency department vists among California residents by age (all ages, 0-17, 18+) for 2009.  </abstract> <purpose>To provide zip code-level data to the public.</purpose> <supplinf>Data has been de-identified to protect patient confidentiality.  Dataset contains 8247 total observations.  Asthma emergency department visits are selected based on primary discharge diagnosis coding.  The California EPHT Program receives calendar year emergency department data annually from the Office of Statewide Health Planning and Development (OSHPD).  Further information on OSHPD is located at:  www.oshpd.ca.gov.  All state licensed hospitals in California are required by California Health and Safety Code to report to OSHPD data elements for each inpatient and outpatient from the hospital.  The facilities submit their data semiannually via the Medical information Reporting for California (MIRCal), an on-line data transmission method.  Additional fields are computed by OSHPD, such as, length of stay, etc.  The patient's Social Security Number is encrypted to create a unique 9-digit record linkage number, which can be used to link records for the same patient.      </supplinf> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <rngdates> <begdate>20090101</begdate> <begtime/> <enddate>20091231</enddate> <endtime/> </rngdates> </timeinfo> <current>Publication Date</current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>Complete</progress> <update>None planned</update> </status> <spdom> <bounding> <westbc>-124.409721</westbc> <eastbc>-114.131208</eastbc> <northbc>42.009521999999997</northbc> <southbc>32.53416</southbc> </bounding> </spdom> <keywords> <theme> <themekt>NONE</themekt> <themekey>Asthma, 493, Emergency Department, Environmental Health Tracking Program, EPHT, Environmental Health</themekey> </theme> <place> <placekt>FIPS 5-2 (State)</placekt> <placekey>California, CA, 06</placekey> </place> <place> <placekt>Zip code</placekt> <placekey>NONE</placekey> </place> <place> <placekt/> <placekey>NONE</placekey> </place> </keywords> <accconst>Restricted (secure) data will only be released to external users after the California EPHT Program and representatives from OSHPD have reviewed the request.  If deemed necessary, the request must include a research protocol and proof of approval by, or exemption from, an Institutional Review Board (IRB) formed and maintained in accordance with the U.S. Dept. of Health and Human Services Code of Federal Regulations for Protection of Human Subjects (45 CFR 46, revised March 8, 1983).  The California Committee for the Protection of Human Subjects serves as the institutional review board (IRB) for the California Health and Human Services Agency.  Information is available at:  http://www.oshpd.ca.gov/boards/cphs/.  </accconst> <useconst>This information is provided by the California Environmental Health Tracking Program (CEHTP) in the California Department of Public Health and the Office of Statewide Health Planning and Development (OSHPD) in the California Health and Human Services Agency.  Efforts have been made to assure the accuracy of the data.  However, no responsibility is assumed by CEHTP or OSHPD, related to materials or how it is represented by those who access this information.  All users must read and fully comprehend metadata prior to data use.    Data may only be used in the manner specified in the data request proposal.  Data will not be released, furnished, disclosed, published or otherwise disseminated to any person (except for employees under supervision of data requestor, who has agreed in writing to comply with these conditions), unless the data has been aggregated and all cell sizes less than 5 are suppressed.     </useconst> <ptcontac> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>CEHTP Science Team</cntper> <cntorg>CDPH/EHIB</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos/> <cntaddr> <addrtype>Mailing and Physical</addrtype> <address>850 Marina Bay Parkway, Bldg P, 3rd Floor  </address> <city>Richmond</city> <state>CA</state> <postal>94804</postal> <country>United States Of America</country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>510-620-3620</cntvoice> <cnttdd/> <cntfax/> <cntemail>data@cehtp.org</cntemail> <hours/> <cntinst/> </cntinfo> </ptcontac> <secinfo> <secsys>None</secsys> <secclass>Restricted</secclass> <sechandl>None</sechandl> </secinfo> <native>SAS 9.1 </native> </idinfo> <dataqual> <logic>NA</logic> <complete>These data include emergency department visits from all licensed hospitals in California.  These data are based only on primary discharge diagnosis codes (ICD9-CM).  Race and ethnicity are not reported in this dataset.</complete> <lineage> <procstep> <procdesc>Since 2005, the Office of Statewide Health Planning and Development (OSHPD) has been responsible for routinely collecting data on emergency department (ED) visits from every licensed acute care hospital in California, excluding federal hospitals. Each year, OSHPD compiles the data from all hospitals to create the Emergency Department and Ambulatory Surgery Database. Each year, CEHTP obtains the ED dataset from OSHPD and creates datasets to be used for public health surveillance, while maintaining confidentiality. This dataset on the CEHTP portal includes ED visits due to asthma for 2009. Each ED event is identified by looking at principal discharge diagnosis based on the International Classification of Disease, Ninth Revision, Clinical Modification (ICD-9-CM). A principal diagnostic ICD-9-CM code of 493 indicates a patient who was seen in the ED because of asthma. Rates were calculated by zip code and age-group. To calculate rates, we use population data from a private vendor that estimated zip code level populations by using U.S. census data, U.S. Postal Service delivery routes, and other data sources. For more information on how the data is calculated and accompanying limitations, see the methods section: http://www.ehib.org/page.jsp?page_key=23</procdesc> <procdate>20111215</procdate> </procstep> </lineage> </dataqual> <eainfo> <overview> <eaover>This dataset contains the following fields:  Zip Start_Date  End_Date  Measure_ID  Measure_VA   Case counts are aggregated according to event date, zip code, and age group.</eaover> <eadetcit>None</eadetcit> </overview> </eainfo> <distinfo> <distrib> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>CEHTP Science Team</cntper> <cntorg>CDPH/EHIB</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos/> <cntaddr> <addrtype>Mailing and Physical</addrtype> <address>850 Marina Bay Parkway, Bldg P, 3rd Floor  </address> <city>Richmond</city> <state>CA</state> <postal>94804</postal> <country>United States Of America</country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>510-620-3620</cntvoice> <cnttdd/> <cntfax/> <cntemail>data@cehtp.org</cntemail> <hours/> <cntinst/> </cntinfo> </distrib> <resdesc>File name:  ASED_zip_temp.dbf     File size:  782 kb</resdesc> <distliab>Persons or entities given access to restricted data are liable for compliance with conditions set forth in the data use agreement.  Disciplinary action will be incurred for non-compliance or violation of data use agreements.</distliab> <custom>For access to data, please contact: data@cehtp.org     </custom> </distinfo> <metainfo> <metd>20120326</metd> <metc> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>CEHTP Science Team</cntper> <cntorg>CDPH/EHIB</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos/> <cntaddr> <addrtype>Mailing and Physical</addrtype> <address>850 Marina Bay Parkway, Bldg P, 3rd Floor  </address> <city>Richmond</city> <state>CA</state> <postal>94804</postal> <country>United States Of America</country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>510-620-3620</cntvoice> <cnttdd/> <cntfax/> <cntemail>data@cehtp.org</cntemail> <hours/> <cntinst/> </cntinfo> </metc> <metstdn>EPHTN Tracking Network Profile Version 1.2</metstdn> <metac>None</metac> <metuc>None</metuc> </metainfo> </metadata>
